revised_title: Automated Site-Directed Drug Design: Molecular Templates in Primary Structure Generation
tldr: This article describes a method for generating molecular templates using spacer skeletons to create putative ligands for binding sites. The process involves fitting and clipping the spacer skeletons to the designated ligand points within the accessible surface of the ligand-binding site. The resulting molecular templates can be further optimized and verified for bonding integrity, providing a foundation for automated site-directed drug design.
